title: U.S. Retrieves Millions Paid to Colonial Pipeline Hackers
summary: Law-enforcement officials recover roughly $2.3 million in digital currency paid after cyberattack that led to closure of East Coast fuel conduit. WASHINGTON-U.S. authorities have recovered millions of dollars in digital currency paid to the hackers who hit a major East Coast fuel pipeline with a ransomware attack last month, in a law-enforcement operation that officials said demonstrated progress undermining criminals' ability to disrupt American commerce and critical infrastructure for profit.

title: Prosecutors Subpoena Material Related to Cuomo's Book
summary: State officials who edited early versions of New York governor's memoir were among those receiving requests for information. Federal prosecutors have subpoenaed material related to New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo's recent memoir as part of their probe into Covid-19 deaths in the state's nursing homes, people familiar with the matter said.

title: Longtime Tesla Executive Guillen Departs
summary: Guillen had been overseeing the electric-vehicle maker's heavy-trucking efforts. A longtime Tesla Inc. executive who was overseeing the electric-vehicle maker's heavy-trucking efforts left the company last week.

title: Skycity's Adelaide Casino Faces Money-Laundering Investigation
summary: Company says it is cooperating in the probe. WELLINGTON, New Zealand-Casino operator Skycity Entertainment Ltd. said an Australian regulator is investigating potential serious breaches of anti-money-laundering and terrorism-financing laws at its Adelaide casino.

title: Canadian Police Say Suspect Targeted Muslims in Fatal Hit-and-Run
summary: Pickup-truck driver faces first-degree murder charges after family was struck in London, Ontario. Canadian police say the driver of a pickup truck allegedly struck a family of five because of their Islamic religion, killing four of them in one of the deadliest attacks against Muslims in Canada since a shooting at a Quebec mosque four years ago.

title: CFOs Plan to Reopen Offices But May Keep Some Pandemic Changes
summary: Finance chiefs at AT&T, Estée Lauder and Salesforce want to hold on to savings. Finance chiefs are drawing up plans to reopen their companies' offices but want to stick to certain changes made during the pandemic to control costs and drive sales.

title: The Big Changes Coming to Your iPhone, iPad and Mac This Fall
summary: Apple's annual Worldwide Developers Conference keynote showed off major updates for FaceTime, AirPods and privacy. Apple is hosting its annual Worldwide Developers Conference virtually for the second year in a row. I tuned in from home for the Monday keynote, where company execs outlined a slew of new updates for Apple devices due this fall via iOS 15, iPadOS 15, WatchOS 8 and MacOS Monterey.

title: Bezos to Lift Off
summary: The entrepreneur leads from the front on commercial space flight.. What's the fun of being the world's richest person if you can't fashion a rocket and launch yourself into space? Say what you will about Jeff Bezos, but he's certainly willing to eat his own cooking. The Journal's Matt Grossman reports:

title: Mexico Checks AMLO's Power
summary: A vote for democracy against the President's radical ambitions.. Believe it or not, there's good news south of the Rio Grande. Mexican voters delivered a sharp rebuke to President Andrés Manuel López Obrador's ruling Morena Party coalition in Sunday's midterm elections, stripping its two-thirds majority in the lower house of Congress. The result weakens AMLO, as the President is known, and his ambitions for a radical "fourth transformation" of Mexico.

title: An Alzheimer's Breakthrough, At Last
summary: The FDA's approval sends a message of hope for millions of patients.. The Food and Drug Administration gave hope to millions of Americans suffering from Alzheimer's disease on Monday by approving Biogen 's aducanumab, the first treatment shown to slow cognitive decline. Credit to Acting Commissioner Janet Woodcock for resisting pressure from the public-health left who campaigned against the drug.

title: Judges, Immigrants and the Rule of Law
summary: The Supreme Court is unanimous: This statute means what it says.. It's usually a good day at the Supreme Court when Justices left and right agree unanimously on the law, helping to restrain lower judges with overactive political imaginations. That happened Monday in Sanchez v. Mayorkas, as the High Court put a corner of immigration law back in proper order.

title: Joe Manchin Plays Political Chess
summary: As progressives rage against him, he's helping the Democratic Party.. Joe Manchin has brought the wrath of the political left down upon him after writing in a hometown newspaper on the weekend that he doesn't support a federal takeover of state voting law and won't break the Senate filibuster. But the West Virginia Senator is playing political chess-and doing Democrats a favor too.

title: I Tip My Cap to You, Joe Manchin
summary: Defying your party's wishes is courageous and can be costly.. Sen. Joe Manchin is a courageous man. He has strong views and hails from a state that values independence. Recently he chose not to support the For the People Act. He also stood up for preserving the Senate filibuster. In both cases he opposed his party's leaders.

title: 'Dangerous Ideas' Review: The Follies of Censorship
summary: Terms like blasphemy, subversion and hate speech are impossible to deﬁne. No wonder attempts at censorship are inconsistent and often absurd.. 'Free Speech Is Killing Us" was the title of a polemical op-ed published in the New York Times in 2019. Surveying various unconnected crimes and political developments, the article's author, New Yorker staff writer Andrew Marantz, warned that "the brutality that germinates on the internet can leap into the world of flesh and blood."

title: More Latinos Bid 'Adios' to Democrats
summary: Election results in Texas show the migration to the GOP may finally be starting.. For decades some conservatives, yours truly among them, have argued that Latino Americans, with their ethic of faith and family and work, ought to be natural Republicans. On Saturday in a South Texas city on the Mexican border, Javier Villalobos gave America a glimpse of what this future might look like when he became the first Republican elected mayor of McAllen-the 85% Latino seat of Hidalgo County.

title: This Isn't Your Grandfather's Turkey
summary: Ankara isn't staunchly pro-Western as in the Cold War, but it's still an important ally.. Ankara, Turkey

title: MicroStrategy to Sell New Bitcoin Bond
summary: Software provider doubles down on bet that digital assets will outperform cash. MicroStrategy Inc. is borrowing $400 million in junk bonds to buy more bitcoins, adding to the company's bet that digital assets will outperform cash.

title: Southwest Airlines Automates Some Job Recruiting Tasks as Air Travel Takes Off
summary: Airline hopes digital job recruiting tools, including chatbots, will substantially reduce the time it takes between posting a job and making an offer. Southwest Airlines Co. is leaning more on digital job placement tools, including chatbots, to speed up the hiring process amid resurging demand and a competitive labor market, a senior recruiting official said.

title: Why I Stopped Hiring Ivy League Graduates
summary: Even those who aren't woke seem damaged by the experience, and they're deprived of role models.. I'm not inclined to hire a graduate from one of America's elite universities. That marks a change. A decade ago I relished the opportunity to employ talented graduates of Princeton, Yale, Harvard and the rest. Today? Not so much.

title: New York City Mayor Urges Stricter Gun Control After Boy Is Killed
summary: Bill de Blasio says NYPD needs help from federal authorities to reverse a rise in shootings. New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio on Monday seized on the fatal shooting of a 10-year-old boy to call for stricter federal gun control and to push for state legislation that would provide more assistance to parolees.

title: Tennessee Scientist Is First to Go on Trial on Charges He Hid Work in China
summary: Prosecutors say the nanotechnology researcher did similar work in both countries while getting money from NASA. Until last year at the University of Tennessee, Anming Hu studied, among other things, how to join certain metals together using materials that are more than 1,000 times smaller than the width of a human hair. He also ran a group developing similar nanoscale technologies at an institute in Beijing.

title: López Obrador Coalition Falls Short of Supermajority in Mexico's Lower House
summary: The president's party will have a far harder time seeking to overhaul the Constitution, political analysts say. MEXICO CITY-President Andrés Manuel López Obrador's party, along with two smaller allied parties, won a majority in the country's lower house in midterm elections but fell well short of a two-thirds majority needed to carry out his economic nationalist agenda.

title: Options Traders Bet on Return of $100 Oil
summary: Investors have scooped up call options tied to crude prices hitting milestone for first time since gush of U.S. oil in 2014. Traders have alighted on what some believe to be a one-way bet in the world's most important commodity market: oil prices going to $100 a barrel.

title: Apple's Tim Cook Kicks Off WWDC by Doubling Down on Privacy
summary: Tech giant also announces updates to FaceTime and Wallet, capping a tense year for company, developers as virtual conference begins. A year after angering software developers with new privacy features aimed at making it harder to track iPhone users' digital footprints, Apple Inc. on Monday doubled down with even more changes that will roil the digital-advertising industry.

title: Commodity Price Surges Add to Inflation Fears
summary: Higher prices for commodities are flowing through to more companies and consumers, making it harder for central bankers to ignore them. The run-up in commodity prices is casting a cloud over the global economic recovery, slamming vulnerable businesses and households and adding to fears that inflation could become more persistent.

title: Stocks Finish in Mixed Territory
summary: Dow recedes after pushing into record territory. The Dow Jones Industrial Average and the S&P 500 slipped Monday after closing near record levels last week.

title: 'Peace or Love' by Kings of Convenience Review: Lilting Into the Spotlight
summary: The Norwegian duo harken back to their folk-pop roots with their first album in over a decade..

title: Trump Casts Shadow on New Jersey Primary
summary: Front-runner Jack Ciattarelli looks to hold off Hirsh Singh, a supporter of the former president, in race for Republican nomination. New Jersey Republicans will head to the polls Tuesday to select their candidate for governor in a race that will test the appeal of former President Donald Trump in this reliably blue state.

title: First Alzheimer's Drug to Slow Disease Is Approved by FDA
summary: Biogen drug approved after facing doubts over whether it slows progression of memory-robbing disease. U.S. health regulators approved the first new Alzheimer's drug in nearly two decades, casting aside doubts about the therapy's effectiveness.

title: New York Senate Passes Antitrust Bill Targeting Tech Giants
summary: Opponents say the measure, which still needs approval by the state Assembly and governor, would trigger torrent of class-action suits. The New York state Senate passed legislation Monday making it easier for plaintiffs to win antimonopoly lawsuits, in the latest state-led effort to rein in large technology companies in the absence of action by Congress.

title: Biogen's Alzheimer's Drug Is a Wall Street Winner
summary: Despite concerns of limited efficacy, company's new Alzheimer's treatment has blockbuster potential. Biogen 's Alzheimer's treatment has reached the market. And all of a sudden, a plodding value stock has a compelling growth story.

title: SEC Chief Calls for New Restrictions on Executive Stock-Trading Plans
summary: Speaking at The Wall Street Journal's CFO Network event, Gary Gensler says he wants to revise the rules to reduce the risk of improper insider trading. The Securities and Exchange Commission is drafting a proposal that would restrict plans that corporate insiders use to avoid insider-trading claims when buying or selling their own company's stock.

title: Central Park Concert to Celebrate New York's Covid-19 Recovery
summary: Record producer Clive Davis has been tapped by mayor to organize the August event. New York will celebrate its rebound from the darkest days of the Covid-19 pandemic with an all-star concert at Central Park's Great Lawn this summer, city officials said Monday.

title: Bezos Gets Set to Blast Into Space Next Month
summary: The New Shepard spacecraft is scheduled for launch from West Texas on July 20. Jeff Bezos plans to travel to space next month as part of the first crew carried by Blue Origin, the Amazon.com Inc. founder's space company.

summary: Keyboards come in many attractive varieties, as evinced by new harpsichord and organ recordings..

title: Supreme Court to Consider State-Secrets Case Involving FBI Surveillance
summary: High court separately declines to hear case challenging male-only registration for the military draft. WASHINGTON-The Supreme Court on Monday agreed to consider a U.S. government appeal that seeks dismissal of a case involving allegations of improper surveillance of Muslims, on the grounds that further litigation risks disclosing state secrets.

title: Face Masks at New York Schools Now Optional Outdoors
summary: State wanted to align school health policies with updated guidelines for summer camps. Just shy of the end of the school year, schools in New York will be allowed to decide if masks are necessary for children and staff during outside activities, Gov. Andrew Cuomo said Monday.

title: Sowell: A Prophet Unheeded by Most Blacks
summary: There is no evidence that continued reliance on Democratic Party principles has done anything to improve the daily lives of black Americans.. While reading Jason Riley's beautiful tribute to Thomas Sowell ("The Soul of Black Conservatism," op-ed, May 29), I was sadly reminded of Dr. Sowell's comments during an interview: "One of the reasons I'm glad to be as old as I am is that it means I may be spared seeing what's going to happen to this country."

title: Times Are Changing but Most Unions Aren't
summary: The house of American labor is more divided and misdirected then it appears because the needs of the American worker have changed.. Regarding Aaron Withe's "A Different Kind of Labor Boss" (op-ed, June 3): What's going on here? Six-figure Google workers want a voice in corporate policies but no collective bargaining. Amazon and Volkswagen workers in Alabama and Tennessee, respectively, rejected the traditional trade-union adversarial philosophy and structure. Richard Brown, the new president of the SEIU local 1000 in California, wants the union to be nonpartisan and allow nonunion members to vote in elections. He will likely face considerable pushback from his sanctioning international union. This is the union that led a split in 2005 from the AFL-CIO and was followed by four other unions with 4.5 million members to form the Change to Win Strategic Organizing Center because the AFL-CIO was too timid and bureaucratic. Mr. Brown should review the history of the CIO of the late 1940s and early 1950s, when it expelled 11 unions for alleged violations of its constitution. Some of these are now members of Change to Win, with a somewhat revised but still adversarial union philosophy.

title: What Does Refusal of Pence's Memoir Mean?
summary: Blocking publication of books subverts people's efforts to use their minds to analyze matters.. I will never understand how a group of citizens can maintain their right to their beliefs, opinions and morals, and at the same time feel justified in taking those same rights from others ("Inside the Blowup Over Pence Memoir," Page One, May 22). If a group wants to have its freedom of speech, how can that same freedom be taken from others? Whether in agreement or not with the publication of Vice President Mike Pence's memoir, it cannot be acceptable that a group of individuals should have the ability to stop such a publication. It should be the decision of the public as to whether to purchase, read, agree or disagree with a publication. I don't need others making that decision for me, and I have no right to make that decision for others.

title: The GOP Can Copy Obama-Holder on Gerrymandering
summary: When will the slumbering (if not moribund) Republican Party awaken to what it can accomplish despite some significant internal disagreements?. Karl Rove correctly points to the success of the Eric Holder-Barack Obama campaign to attack gerrymandering in red states ("Gerrymanders and Double Standards," op-ed, May 20). Of course they will not attack gerrymandering in blue states. That is not their goal, job or plan. Similarly, in the same-day op-ed, "Why the British Right Is Up, but America's Is Down," Augustus Howard shows the success of the Democratic Party in recognizing that Joe Biden as a described centrist would be more appealing to the national electorate than Bernie Sanders.

title: Poor Countries to Urge G-7 Members to Share More Covid-19 Vaccines
summary: Billions in financing is proposed to help address a shortage of shots in developing nations. Public-health officials and leaders in developing-world countries are expected to press the Group of Seven countries to commit to large donations of Covid-19 vaccines and billions in financing at a summit later this week, saying the developing world needs more help to emerge from the worst of the pandemic.

title: Bruce Springsteen Set to Return to Broadway
summary: The Boss will reprise his successful one-man 'Springsteen on Broadway' show, with performances running June 26 to Sept. 4. The boss is coming back to Broadway.

title: Floyd Mayweather vs. Logan Paul Fight Marred by Streaming Glitch
summary: Outage began more than an hour before YouTube creator's scheduled match with boxer, which ended without official winner. A major blow in Sunday night's fight featuring YouTube creator Logan Paul and boxer Floyd Mayweather Jr. landed before a single punch was thrown.

title: Pakistan Train Crash Kills at Least 48
summary: Disaster left some injured passengers trapped in wreckage for hours. ISLAMABAD, Pakistan-At least 48 people were killed in an early morning train crash in southern Pakistan, the latest in a series of deadly railway accidents in recent years in the country.

title: Israel Lawmakers to Cast Vote of Confidence in New Government by June 14
summary: Netanyahu might have a week to campaign against a coalition that could lead to his losing power. TEL AVIV-Israeli lawmakers will convene by June 14 to cast their vote of confidence in a new coalition government, the Knesset's speaker said Monday, but he didn't set a date for the vote as Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu attempts to scuttle a political arrangement that would unseat him.

title: Mayweather vs. Logan Paul: For the Money and the Clicks
summary: A boxing retiree takes on a social media phenom in a fight for attention and cash. The 44-year-old boxer Floyd Mayweather fought the YouTube star Logan Paul Sunday night, not for posterity, or any compelling athletic reason, but for the algorithm.

summary: Resume Subscription. ARGHANDAB, Afghanistan-The Taliban are encircling Afghan police and army positions and encroaching on government-held territory, positioning themselves for large-scale offensives against major population centers while waiting for the last American troops to depart Afghanistan.

summary: Unanimous ruling says Temporary Protected Status doesn't convert illegal entry to lawful admission. summary: Resume Subscription. Kathryn Garcia's first job in city government was at 22 years old as an intern in New York City's Department of Sanitation in 1993, answering correspondence and doing data analytics.

title: What Can You Do to Lower Your Risk of Alzheimer's Disease?
summary: A leading researcher on Alzheimer's discusses the latest tools for detecting the disease, health steps you can take and what advances he sees for the next 10 years. How can I prevent Alzheimer's? Are there any treatments out there for people who already have it?

title: Some Brands Improved Customer Service Despite Pandemic
summary: Or maybe because of it. In the turmoil of the past year, businesses may have discovered customer service was one thing still in their control. And the top scorer in the Forrester study was .... A number of brands managed to improve their customers' experience over the past year despite the obstacles thrown in their way by the pandemic, a new study found.

title: The Fed's Risky Fill-the-Punch-Bowl Strategy
summary: Growth is surging, the housing market is hot, and inflation is on the rise. It's time to pull back.. My mentor, the late George Shultz, would often say "an economist's lag is a politician's nightmare." Changes in economic policy take several quarters to affect the real economy. Politicians usually aren't that patient.

title: America's Covid Groupthink Functioned Like China's Repression
summary: Marching in ideological lockstep is less forgivable in a society where one has a choice in the matter.. What we eventually learn about the origins of Covid-19 may implicate China's government in failure and falsehood on a grand scale. But before we get too carried away with the endemic failures of the communist order, we should ponder that the episode has exposed layers of rottenness in critical institutions of American civil society that are similarly damning.

title: Mark Cuban-Backed Personal Finance App Dave to Go Public in $4 Billion SPAC Deal
summary: Banking app was launched in 2017 to help consumers avoid bank-overdraft fees. A special-purpose acquisition company sponsored by Victory Park Capital has agreed to merge with banking app Dave, allowing the financial startup to begin operating as a public company.

title: The Key to Getting People to Be Safer Online: Make the Appeals More Personal
summary: The nudges we currently use to prod people to use stronger passwords are aimed at the 'average' user. But few people are average.. Many of us know that strong passwords are crucial protection against hackers, yet many people still routinely use weak ones. So, how can they be encouraged to create stronger passwords? Our research suggests the answer is to make the appeal more personal.

title: Helping Kids Manage Anxiety and Ease Back Into Activities This Summer
summary: As kids start to get back out in the world as the pandemic recedes, some are anxious. Here are concrete ways to help them.. As a most unusual-and exhausting-school year winds down, families are looking at a summer of changing pandemic rules and new possibilities. For many kids, there's excitement about camp and beach vacations. But there are a lot of questions and anxiety during this transition, too, psychologists say.

That offers a rare opportunity to retailers, who are trying to anticipate what their customers will now want to wear to work. Here's what office dress codes might look like as the country opens back up.

title: India Pushes to Speed Covid-19 Vaccinations With Bigger Federal Role

summary: Event hosts are offering green, yellow or red wristbands to let people know if they can come in for that hug-or not. It can get little awkward; 'The greens are just ready to party'. title: Boosters (Monday Crossword, June 7)
What You Should Know About '529' Education-Savings Accounts
summary: Despite all the benefits of these state-sponsored, tax-advantaged accounts, many people still don't have them. The college-savings accounts known as 529 plans can be confusing. Parents know they have tax advantages. But what exactly are those advantages? What investment options make the most sense? Which expenses qualify and which don't? With so many questions, many parents don't even bother. So to help clear away some of the fog, here are answers to common questions about 529 plans.

title: Simone Biles's Ultimate Power Move: A Post-Olympics Tour of Her Own
summary: The superstar gymnast continues a trend of female athletes aiming to increase their control over events long run by their sports' governing bodies. For years, the post-Olympic tour was a showcase for USA Gymnastics, a traveling spectacle of highly decorated heroines flanked by male gymnasts, rhythmic gymnasts, trampoline gymnasts and acrobatic gymnasts.

title: Biden's Agenda Takes On GOP Resistance in Senate
summary: Democrats' hurdles mount as pivotal centrist, Sen. Joe Manchin, says he wouldn't support voting-rules bill. WASHINGTON-Many of President Biden's priorities are in danger of stalling as the Senate returns on Monday, with measures on voting, infrastructure and other issues facing firm Republican resistance and opposition from a handful of centrist Democrats.

title: Move to a New City for Work? No Thanks
summary: Most Popular News. Fewer workers have been moving for new jobs during the pandemic. Will anyone want to when it's over?
